intro: Basanacantha spinosa var. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy spiny nightshade, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other nightshades such as tomatoes and peppers. The plant is characterized by its spiny stems and hairy leaves, which provide a degree of protection against herbivores. Its flowers are typically white or pale blue, and it produces small, toxic berries that are often used in traditional medicine. Due to its toxic properties, it is important to handle the plant with care.
